description_txt: stated on November 4, 2010 in a radio show:
quote_txt: Says "6 percent more Republicans across the state voted than Democrats."

description_txt: stated on October 12, 2010 in a statement in the Times-Dispatch voters' guide:
quote_txt: "If all of the [Bush-era] tax cuts expire on schedule, the budget will be close to being balanced in four years."

description_txt: stated on October 24, 2010 in an interview on "This Week.":
quote_txt: When Obama took office "the economy of the United States was actually shrinking for the first time in about 70 years."

description_txt: stated on November 21, 2010 in a statement in a Seattle Times article:
quote_txt: Says Washington state has "consistently ranked in the top five in the Forbes list of best states to do business — ahead of Texas."

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2010 in a doorknob flier:
quote_txt: "In fact, 85 percent of Oregonians voted in 2008."

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2010 in a newspaper article:
quote_txt: The Fulton County vote count will be finished by 11:30 p.m. on election night.

description_txt: stated on November 3, 2010 in a CNN interview:
quote_txt: "The president of the United States will be taking a trip over to India that is expected to cost the taxpayers $200 million a day."

description_txt: stated on September 8, 2010 in a statment on his website:
quote_txt: "Congressman Nye voted against a bill which would have defunded the $5-10 billion" the IRS needed to implement  health care legislation.

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2010 in a campaign mailer:
quote_txt: "Congresswoman Kathy Castor voted to spend $2.6 million to teach prostitutes in China to drink responsibly."

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2010 in a debate:
quote_txt: "Mr. Renacci was registered as a foreign trade lobbyist in the United States government."

description_txt: stated on October 28, 2010 in a campaign TV ad:
quote_txt: Says "Scott Walker wants to ban common forms of birth control, including the pill."

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2010 in an automated phone message, as well as a radio ad, news releases and debates:
quote_txt: Says Russ Feingold voted to give Social Security benefits to illegal immigrants

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2010 in a campaign mailer:
quote_txt: Says Steve Spinnett has court judgments against him for trespass and harassment.

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2010 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says he has a track record of not raising taxes.

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2010 in an interview.:
quote_txt: Says that under Gov. Rick Perry, Texas Department of Public Safety troopers have had "standing orders" not to inquire into the immigration status of people unless they're under arrest.

description_txt: stated on October 13, 2010 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Robert Hurt supported a bill that helped the uranium industry after taking contributions from the industry and because his father had a stake in it.

description_txt: stated on October 21, 2010 in a campaign Web ad:
quote_txt: Says John Raese said he wants "1,000 laser systems put in the sky, and we need it right now."

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2010 in a Saturday address:
quote_txt: Members of Congress did not have three days to read the bill "when the stimulus was rushed into law."

description_txt: stated on October 14, 2010 in a campaign video:
quote_txt: "(John) Kasich was the architect who balanced the budget, cut spending, created a surplus, igniting record job creation."

description_txt: stated on October 28, 2010 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "Liberal out-of-state special interests are spending millions on 5 and 6 to change the way Florida draws its congressional and legislative districts."

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2010 in a mailer:
quote_txt: "Paul Workman wants to raise the sales tax."

description_txt: stated on October 24, 2010 in a campaign mailer:
quote_txt: Says Nick Kahl made it harder for many families to cover basic health care expenses.

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2010 in his weekly address:
quote_txt: "The Republican leader of the Senate said his main goal after this election is simply to win the next one."

description_txt: stated on October 12, 2010 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "Senator Robert Hurt voted for a bill that’s raised your electric rates seven times."

description_txt: stated on October 14, 2010 in a statement on candidate's web site:
quote_txt: "Congressman Perriello voted in lock step with Nancy Pelosi 90 percent of the time."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2010 in a TV ad.:
quote_txt: Patrick Rose "voted to explore a state income tax."

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2010 in a campaign TV ad:
quote_txt: Says four Democratic state senators voted to "raise taxes on Wisconsin workers by another $510 a month so freeloaders can get free state-run health care."

description_txt: stated on October 9, 2010 in a campaign TV ad:
quote_txt: Democratic U.S. House candidate Julie Lassa pushed for a "Canadian-style government takeover of health care."

name_txt: Georgia House Democratic Caucus on behalf of Elena Parent
description_txt: stated on October 13, 2010 in a campaign mailer:
quote_txt: State House incumbent Jill Chambers, R-Atlanta, "personally profits from taxpayer money."

description_txt: stated on October 29, 2010 in a campaign mailer:
quote_txt: Says "Richard Devlin raised your taxes by $1 billion in a single day."
